American Civil Liberties Union has uncovered thousands of pages of government documents that show that torture was authorized at the highest levels of the Bush administration. Jameel Jaffer , Deputy Legal Director of the ACLU: Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's claim that the abuse at Abu Ghraib was isolated and aberrational is demonstrably false. Government documents show that the methods used at Abu Ghraib were the same ones Mr. Donald Rumsfeld approved, and that the abuse of prisoners in Defense Department custody was systemic. If there's any ''known known,' it''s that Donald Rumsfeld joined with other officials to orchestrate a program of torture. This effort to rewrite history is shameful. ''Tahrir Square filled again with vast crowds of anti-government demonstrators Friday, demanding for the 11th day the immediate ouster of Egyptian Ronald Reagan Hosni Mubarak ,'' the Washington Post reports. So far: Friday's gathering was calm and orderly, without the beatings, bloodshed and widespread arrests of foreign journalists and observers that had sparked outrage the day before. And it appears the Egyptian army is trying to protect the protestors.
